definition: ministries and commissions
ministry/department/section/part/division/troops/board/classifier for works of literature, films, machines etc
same as 逶 in 逶迤 winding, curved
surname Wei
to entrust/to cast aside/to shift (blame etc)/to accumulate/roundabout/winding/dejected/listless/committee member/council/end/actually/certainly

sentences.english: It has also institutionalized close coordination among government ministries on the front line of disaster relief.
sentences.chinese: 還使各部委在救災前線的密切協作制度化。

sentences.english: This concern is shared among governments, and among their multiple ministries, all around the world.
sentences.chinese: 這是全世界各國政府及其衆多部委共同關注的問題。

sentences.english: Heads of the state ministries visit Beijing Overseas Students Pioneer Park.
sentences.chinese: 中央有關部委領導參觀北京市留學人員創業園。

sentences.english: Six months ago, D. O. D Terminated his contract at the request of the state department.
sentences.chinese: 六個月前，國防部拒絕了他進入國家部委的申請。

sentences.english: Those agencies have refused to comment since Thursday.
sentences.chinese: 自從上週四以來，發文的三部委均拒絕就此置評。

sentences.english: The Chinese government has also revamped the administrative laws and regulations at ministerial and local levels.
sentences.chinese: 中國政府還全面清理了部委和地方的行政法規。

sentences.english: The idea is to establish such a dialogue at the ministerial level.
sentences.chinese: 這個構想就是建立這樣一種部委級別的的對話。
